title: A Rare Onset of T Lymphoid Blast Crisis in Chronic Myeloid Leukemia with Two Distinct Blast Populations
content: In chronic myeloid leukemia (CML), a clonal proliferative disorder of granulocytic lineage, the 90%‚Äê95% of cases are characterized by t(9;22) (q34.1;q11.2) translocation, leading to the Philadelphia chromosome (1). Rarely, CML patients directly present a blast crisis, mostly of myeloid origin (2, 3). Herein, we describe one rare CML case, showing an unusual early T lymphoid blastic crisis.
